commit.message:
configure.in: Set and substitute quoted_cc_set_by_configure.

        * configure.in: Set and substitute quoted_cc_set_by_configure.
        * configure: Rebuilt.
        * Makefile.in (SUBDIR_FLAGS_TO_PASS): Fix quoting problem with ``.

From-SVN: r26129

files.patch:
@@ -1,3 +1,9 @@
+Fri Apr  2 15:46:25 1999  Donn Terry (donn@interix.com)
+
+        * configure.in: Set and substitute quoted_cc_set_by_configure.
+	* configure: Rebuilt.
+	* Makefile.in (SUBDIR_FLAGS_TO_PASS): Fix quoting problem with ``.
+
 Fri Apr  2 14:35:45 1999  Stan Cox  <scox@cygnus.com>
 
 	* config/i386/cygwin.h (CPP_SPEC): Use mingw_include_path instead

@@ -656,6 +656,7 @@ PREPEND_DOTDOT_TO_RELATIVE_PATHS = sed \
 	-e 's|%||g'
 SUBDIR_FLAGS_TO_PASS = $(ORDINARY_FLAGS_TO_PASS) \
   "CC=`echo @cc_set_by_configure@ | $(PREPEND_DOTDOT_TO_RELATIVE_PATHS)`"
+  "CC=`echo @quoted_cc_set_by_configure@ | $(PREPEND_DOTDOT_TO_RELATIVE_PATHS)`"
 # 
 # Lists of files for various purposes.

@@ -2135,7 +2135,6 @@ else
 /* We use char because int might match the return type of a gcc2
     builtin and then its argument prototype would still apply.  */
 char $ac_func();
-char (*f)();
 
 int main() {
 
@@ -2145,12 +2144,12 @@ int main() {
 #if defined (__stub_$ac_func) || defined (__stub___$ac_func)
 choke me
 #else
-f = $ac_func;
+$ac_func();
 #endif
 
 ; return 0; }
 EOF
-if { (eval echo configure:2154: \"$ac_link\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_link) 2>&5; } && test -s conftest${ac_exeext}; then
+if { (eval echo configure:2153: \"$ac_link\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_link) 2>&5; } && test -s conftest${ac_exeext}; then
   rm -rf conftest*
   eval "ac_cv_func_$ac_func=yes"
 else
@@ -2179,12 +2178,12 @@ done
 #AC_CHECK_TYPE(wchar_t, unsigned int)
 
 echo $ac_n "checking for vprintf""... $ac_c" 1>&6
-echo "configure:2183: checking for vprintf" >&5
+echo "configure:2182: checking for vprintf" >&5
 if eval "test \"`echo '$''{'ac_cv_func_vprintf'+set}'`\" = set"; then
   echo $ac_n "(cached) $ac_c" 1>&6
 else
   cat > conftest.$ac_ext <<EOF
-#line 2188 "configure"
+#line 2187 "configure"
 #include "confdefs.h"
 /* System header to define __stub macros and hopefully few prototypes,
     which can conflict with char vprintf(); below.  */
@@ -2193,7 +2192,6 @@ else
 /* We use char because int might match the return type of a gcc2
     builtin and then its argument prototype would still apply.  */
 char vprintf();
-char (*f)();
 
 int main() {
 
@@ -2203,12 +2201,12 @@ int main() {
 #if defined (__stub_vprintf) || defined (__stub___vprintf)
 choke me
 #else
-f = vprintf;
+vprintf();
 #endif
 
 ; return 0; }
 EOF
-if { (eval echo configure:2212: \"$ac_link\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_link) 2>&5; } && test -s conftest${ac_exeext}; then
+if { (eval echo configure:2210: \"$ac_link\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_link) 2>&5; } && test -s conftest${ac_exeext}; then
   rm -rf conftest*
   eval "ac_cv_func_vprintf=yes"
 else
@@ -2232,12 +2230,12 @@ fi
 
 if test "$ac_cv_func_vprintf" != yes; then
 echo $ac_n "checking for _doprnt""... $ac_c" 1>&6
-echo "configure:2236: checking for _doprnt" >&5
+echo "configure:2234: checking for _doprnt" >&5
 if eval "test \"`echo '$''{'ac_cv_func__doprnt'+set}'`\" = set"; then
   echo $ac_n "(cached) $ac_c" 1>&6
 else
   cat > conftest.$ac_ext <<EOF
-#line 2241 "configure"
+#line 2239 "configure"
 #include "confdefs.h"
 /* System header to define __stub macros and hopefully few prototypes,
     which can conflict with char _doprnt(); below.  */
@@ -2246,7 +2244,6 @@ else
 /* We use char because int might match the return type of a gcc2
     builtin and then its argument prototype would still apply.  */
 char _doprnt();
-char (*f)();
 
 int main() {
 
@@ -2256,12 +2253,12 @@ int main() {
 #if defined (__stub__doprnt) || defined (__stub____doprnt)
 choke me
 #else
-f = _doprnt;
+_doprnt();
 #endif
 
 ; return 0; }
 EOF
-if { (eval echo configure:2265: \"$ac_link\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_link) 2>&5; } && test -s conftest${ac_exeext}; then
+if { (eval echo configure:2262: \"$ac_link\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_link) 2>&5; } && test -s conftest${ac_exeext}; then
   rm -rf conftest*
   eval "ac_cv_func__doprnt=yes"
 else
@@ -2297,15 +2294,15 @@ fi
 
 
 echo $ac_n "checking whether the printf functions support %p""... $ac_c" 1>&6
-echo "configure:2301: checking whether the printf functions support %p" >&5
+echo "configure:2298: checking whether the printf functions support %p" >&5
 if eval "test \"`echo '$''{'gcc_cv_func_printf_ptr'+set}'`\" = set"; then
   echo $ac_n "(cached) $ac_c" 1>&6
 else
   if test "$cross_compiling" = yes; then
   gcc_cv_func_printf_ptr=no
 else
   cat > conftest.$ac_ext <<EOF
-#line 2309 "configure"
+#line 2306 "configure"
 #include "confdefs.h"
 #include <stdio.h>
 
@@ -2318,7 +2315,7 @@ main()
   exit (p != q);
 }
 EOF
-if { (eval echo configure:2322: \"$ac_link\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_link) 2>&5; } && test -s conftest${ac_exeext} && (./conftest; exit) 2>/dev/null
+if { (eval echo configure:2319: \"$ac_link\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_link) 2>&5; } && test -s conftest${ac_exeext} && (./conftest; exit) 2>/dev/null
 then
   gcc_cv_func_printf_ptr=yes
 else
@@ -2351,12 +2348,12 @@ case "${host}" in
   ;;
 esac
 echo $ac_n "checking for pid_t""... $ac_c" 1>&6
-echo "configure:2355: checking for pid_t" >&5
+echo "configure:2352: checking for pid_t" >&5
 if eval "test \"`echo '$''{'ac_cv_type_pid_t'+set}'`\" = set"; then
   echo $ac_n "(cached) $ac_c" 1>&6
 else
   cat > conftest.$ac_ext <<EOF
-#line 2360 "configure"
+#line 2357 "configure"
 #include "confdefs.h"
 #include <sys/types.h>
 #if STDC_HEADERS
@@ -2385,17 +2382,17 @@ fi
 
 ac_safe=`echo "vfork.h" | sed 'y%./+-%__p_%'`
 echo $ac_n "checking for vfork.h""... $ac_c" 1>&6
-echo "configure:2389: checking for vfork.h" >&5
+echo "configure:2386: checking for vfork.h" >&5
 if eval "test \"`echo '$''{'ac_cv_header_$ac_safe'+set}'`\" = set"; then
   echo $ac_n "(cached) $ac_c" 1>&6
 else
   cat > conftest.$ac_ext <<EOF
-#line 2394 "configure"
+#line 2391 "configure"
 #include "confdefs.h"
 #include <vfork.h>
 EOF
 ac_try="$ac_cpp conftest.$ac_ext >/dev/null 2>conftest.out"
-{ (eval echo configure:2399: \"$ac_try\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_try) 2>&5; }
+{ (eval echo configure:2396: \"$ac_try\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_try) 2>&5; }
 ac_err=`grep -v '^ *+' conftest.out | grep -v "^conftest.${ac_ext}\$"`
 if test -z "$ac_err"; then
   rm -rf conftest*
@@ -2420,18 +2417,18 @@ else
 fi
 
 echo $ac_n "checking for working vfork""... $ac_c" 1>&6
-echo "configure:2424: checking for working vfork" >&5
+echo "configure:2421: checking for working vfork" >&5
 if eval "test \"`echo '$''{'ac_cv_func_vfork_works'+set}'`\" = set"; then
   echo $ac_n "(cached) $ac_c" 1>&6
 else
   if test "$cross_compiling" = yes; then
   echo $ac_n "checking for vfork""... $ac_c" 1>&6
-echo "configure:2430: checking for vfork" >&5
+echo "configure:2427: checking for vfork" >&5
 if eval "test \"`echo '$''{'ac_cv_func_vfork'+set}'`\" = set"; then
   echo $ac_n "(cached) $ac_c" 1>&6
 else
   cat > conftest.$ac_ext <<EOF
-#line 2435 "configure"
+#line 2432 "configure"
 #include "confdefs.h"
 /* System header to define __stub macros and hopefully few prototypes,
     which can conflict with char vfork(); below.  */
@@ -2440,7 +2437,6 @@ else
 /* We use char because int might match the return type of a gcc2
     builtin and then its argument prototype would still apply.  */
 char vfork();
-char (*f)();
 
 int main() {
 
@@ -2450,12 +2446,12 @@ int main() {
 #if defined (__stub_vfork) || defined (__stub___vfork)
 choke me
 #else
-f = vfork;
+vfork();
 #endif
 
 ; return 0; }
 EOF
-if { (eval echo configure:2459: \"$ac_link\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_link) 2>&5; } && test -s conftest${ac_exeext}; then
+if { (eval echo configure:2455: \"$ac_link\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_link) 2>&5; } && test -s conftest${ac_exeext}; then
   rm -rf conftest*
   eval "ac_cv_func_vfork=yes"
 else
@@ -2477,7 +2473,7 @@ fi
 ac_cv_func_vfork_works=$ac_cv_func_vfork
 else
   cat > conftest.$ac_ext <<EOF
-#line 2481 "configure"
+#line 2477 "configure"
 #include "confdefs.h"
 /* Thanks to Paul Eggert for this test.  */
 #include <stdio.h>
@@ -2572,7 +2568,7 @@ main() {
   }
 }
 EOF
-if { (eval echo configure:2576: \"$ac_link\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_link) 2>&5; } && test -s conftest${ac_exeext} && (./conftest; exit) 2>/dev/null
+if { (eval echo configure:2572: \"$ac_link\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_link) 2>&5; } && test -s conftest${ac_exeext} && (./conftest; exit) 2>/dev/null
 then
   ac_cv_func_vfork_works=yes
 else
@@ -2600,12 +2596,12 @@ for ac_func in malloc realloc calloc free bcopy bzero bcmp \
 	strsignal putc_unlocked fputs_unlocked
 do
 echo $ac_n "checking whether $ac_func must be declared""... $ac_c" 1>&6
-echo "configure:2604: checking whether $ac_func must be declared" >&5
+echo "configure:2600: checking whether $ac_func must be declared" >&5
 if eval "test \"`echo '$''{'gcc_cv_decl_needed_$ac_func'+set}'`\" = set"; then
   echo $ac_n "(cached) $ac_c" 1>&6
 else
   cat > conftest.$ac_ext <<EOF
-#line 2609 "configure"
+#line 2605 "configure"
 #include "confdefs.h"
 
 #include <stdio.h>
@@ -2638,7 +2634,7 @@ int main() {
 char *(*pfn) = (char *(*)) $ac_func
 ; return 0; }
 EOF
-if { (eval echo configure:2642: \"$ac_compile\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_compile) 2>&5; }; then
+if { (eval echo configure:2638: \"$ac_compile\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_compile) 2>&5; }; then
   rm -rf conftest*
   eval "gcc_cv_decl_needed_$ac_func=no"
 else
@@ -2667,12 +2663,12 @@ done
 for ac_func in getrlimit setrlimit
 do
 echo $ac_n "checking whether $ac_func must be declared""... $ac_c" 1>&6
-echo "configure:2671: checking whether $ac_func must be declared" >&5
+echo "configure:2667: checking whether $ac_func must be declared" >&5
 if eval "test \"`echo '$''{'gcc_cv_decl_needed_$ac_func'+set}'`\" = set"; then
   echo $ac_n "(cached) $ac_c" 1>&6
 else
   cat > conftest.$ac_ext <<EOF
-#line 2676 "configure"
+#line 2672 "configure"
 #include "confdefs.h"
 
 #include <stdio.h>
@@ -2709,7 +2705,7 @@ int main() {
 char *(*pfn) = (char *(*)) $ac_func
 ; return 0; }
 EOF
-if { (eval echo configure:2713: \"$ac_compile\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_compile) 2>&5; }; then
+if { (eval echo configure:2709: \"$ac_compile\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_compile) 2>&5; }; then
   rm -rf conftest*
   eval "gcc_cv_decl_needed_$ac_func=no"
 else
@@ -2736,12 +2732,12 @@ done
 
 
 echo $ac_n "checking for sys_siglist declaration in signal.h or unistd.h""... $ac_c" 1>&6
-echo "configure:2740: checking for sys_siglist declaration in signal.h or unistd.h" >&5
+echo "configure:2736: checking for sys_siglist declaration in signal.h or unistd.h" >&5
 if eval "test \"`echo '$''{'ac_cv_decl_sys_siglist'+set}'`\" = set"; then
   echo $ac_n "(cached) $ac_c" 1>&6
 else
   cat > conftest.$ac_ext <<EOF
-#line 2745 "configure"
+#line 2741 "configure"
 #include "confdefs.h"
 #include <sys/types.h>
 #include <signal.h>
@@ -2753,7 +2749,7 @@ int main() {
 char *msg = *(sys_siglist + 1);
 ; return 0; }
 EOF
-if { (eval echo configure:2757: \"$ac_compile\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_compile) 2>&5; }; then
+if { (eval echo configure:2753: \"$ac_compile\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_compile) 2>&5; }; then
   rm -rf conftest*
   ac_cv_decl_sys_siglist=yes
 else
@@ -5923,15 +5919,15 @@ fi
 
 
         echo $ac_n "checking for strerror in -lcposix""... $ac_c" 1>&6
-echo "configure:5922: checking for strerror in -lcposix" >&5
+echo "configure:5923: checking for strerror in -lcposix" >&5
 ac_lib_var=`echo cposix'_'strerror | sed 'y%./+-%__p_%'`
 if eval "test \"`echo '$''{'ac_cv_lib_$ac_lib_var'+set}'`\" = set"; then
   echo $ac_n "(cached) $ac_c" 1>&6
 else
   ac_save_LIBS="$LIBS"
 LIBS="-lcposix  $LIBS"
 cat > conftest.$ac_ext <<EOF
-#line 5930 "configure"
+#line 5931 "configure"
 #include "confdefs.h"
 /* Override any gcc2 internal prototype to avoid an error.  */
 /* We use char because int might match the return type of a gcc2
@@ -5942,7 +5938,7 @@ int main() {
 strerror()
 ; return 0; }
 EOF
-if { (eval echo configure:5941: \"$ac_link\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_link) 2>&5; } && test -s conftest${ac_exeext}; then
+if { (eval echo configure:5942: \"$ac_link\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_link) 2>&5; } && test -s conftest${ac_exeext}; then
   rm -rf conftest*
   eval "ac_cv_lib_$ac_lib_var=yes"
 else
@@ -5965,12 +5961,12 @@ fi
   
 
 echo $ac_n "checking for working const""... $ac_c" 1>&6
-echo "configure:5964: checking for working const" >&5
+echo "configure:5965: checking for working const" >&5
 if eval "test \"`echo '$''{'ac_cv_c_const'+set}'`\" = set"; then
   echo $ac_n "(cached) $ac_c" 1>&6
 else
   cat > conftest.$ac_ext <<EOF
-#line 5969 "configure"
+#line 5970 "configure"
 #include "confdefs.h"
 
 int main() {
@@ -6019,7 +6015,7 @@ ccp = (char const *const *) p;
 
 ; return 0; }
 EOF
-if { (eval echo configure:6018: \"$ac_compile\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_compile) 2>&5; }; then
+if { (eval echo configure:6019: \"$ac_compile\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_compile) 2>&5; }; then
   rm -rf conftest*
   ac_cv_c_const=yes
 else
@@ -6040,21 +6036,21 @@ EOF
 fi
 
 echo $ac_n "checking for inline""... $ac_c" 1>&6
-echo "configure:6039: checking for inline" >&5
+echo "configure:6040: checking for inline" >&5
 if eval "test \"`echo '$''{'ac_cv_c_inline'+set}'`\" = set"; then
   echo $ac_n "(cached) $ac_c" 1>&6
 else
   ac_cv_c_inline=no
 for ac_kw in inline __inline__ __inline; do
   cat > conftest.$ac_ext <<EOF
-#line 6046 "configure"
+#line 6047 "configure"
 #include "confdefs.h"
 
 int main() {
 } $ac_kw foo() {
 ; return 0; }
 EOF
-if { (eval echo configure:6053: \"$ac_compile\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_compile) 2>&5; }; then
+if { (eval echo configure:6054: \"$ac_compile\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_compile) 2>&5; }; then
   rm -rf conftest*
   ac_cv_c_inline=$ac_kw; break
 else
@@ -6080,12 +6076,12 @@ EOF
 esac
 
 echo $ac_n "checking for off_t""... $ac_c" 1>&6
-echo "configure:6079: checking for off_t" >&5
+echo "configure:6080: checking for off_t" >&5
 if eval "test \"`echo '$''{'ac_cv_type_off_t'+set}'`\" = set"; then
   echo $ac_n "(cached) $ac_c" 1>&6
 else
   cat > conftest.$ac_ext <<EOF
-#line 6084 "configure"
+#line 6085 "configure"
 #include "confdefs.h"
 #include <sys/types.h>
 #if STDC_HEADERS
@@ -6113,12 +6109,12 @@ EOF
 fi
 
 echo $ac_n "checking for size_t""... $ac_c" 1>&6
-echo "configure:6112: checking for size_t" >&5
+echo "configure:6113: checking for size_t" >&5
 if eval "test \"`echo '$''{'ac_cv_type_size_t'+set}'`\" = set"; then
   echo $ac_n "(cached) $ac_c" 1>&6
 else
   cat > conftest.$ac_ext <<EOF
-#line 6117 "configure"
+#line 6118 "configure"
 #include "confdefs.h"
 #include <sys/types.h>
 #if STDC_HEADERS
@@ -6148,19 +6144,19 @@ fi
 # The Ultrix 4.2 mips builtin alloca declared by alloca.h only works
 # for constant arguments.  Useless!
 echo $ac_n "checking for working alloca.h""... $ac_c" 1>&6
-echo "configure:6147: checking for working alloca.h" >&5
+echo "configure:6148: checking for working alloca.h" >&5
 if eval "test \"`echo '$''{'ac_cv_header_alloca_h'+set}'`\" = set"; then
   echo $ac_n "(cached) $ac_c" 1>&6

   cat > conftest.$ac_ext <<EOF
-#line 6152 "configure"
+#line 6153 "configure"

 int main() {
 char *p = alloca(2 * sizeof(int));
 ; return 0; }
 EOF
-if { (eval echo configure:6159: \"$ac_link\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_link) 2>&5; } && test -s conftest${ac_exeext}; then
+if { (eval echo configure:6160: \"$ac_link\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_link) 2>&5; } && test -s conftest${ac_exeext}; then
   rm -rf conftest*
   ac_cv_header_alloca_h=yes
 else
@@ -6181,12 +6177,12 @@ EOF
 fi
 
 echo $ac_n "checking for alloca""... $ac_c" 1>&6
-echo "configure:6180: checking for alloca" >&5
+echo "configure:6181: checking for alloca" >&5
 if eval "test \"`echo '$''{'ac_cv_func_alloca_works'+set}'`\" = set"; then
   echo $ac_n "(cached) $ac_c" 1>&6
 else
   cat > conftest.$ac_ext <<EOF
-#line 6185 "configure"
+#line 6186 "configure"
 #include "confdefs.h"
 
 #ifdef __GNUC__
@@ -6214,7 +6210,7 @@ int main() {
 char *p = (char *) alloca(1);
 ; return 0; }
 EOF
-if { (eval echo configure:6213: \"$ac_link\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_link) 2>&5; } && test -s conftest${ac_exeext}; then
+if { (eval echo configure:6214: \"$ac_link\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_link) 2>&5; } && test -s conftest${ac_exeext}; then
   rm -rf conftest*
   ac_cv_func_alloca_works=yes
 else
@@ -6246,12 +6242,12 @@ EOF
 
 
 echo $ac_n "checking whether alloca needs Cray hooks""... $ac_c" 1>&6
-echo "configure:6245: checking whether alloca needs Cray hooks" >&5
+echo "configure:6246: checking whether alloca needs Cray hooks" >&5
 if eval "test \"`echo '$''{'ac_cv_os_cray'+set}'`\" = set"; then
   echo $ac_n "(cached) $ac_c" 1>&6
 else
   cat > conftest.$ac_ext <<EOF
-#line 6250 "configure"

 webecray
@@ -6276,12 +6272,12 @@ echo "$ac_t""$ac_cv_os_cray" 1>&6
 if test $ac_cv_os_cray = yes; then
 for ac_func in _getb67 GETB67 getb67; do
   echo $ac_n "checking for $ac_func""... $ac_c" 1>&6
-echo "configure:6275: checking for $ac_func" >&5

 if eval "test \"`echo '$''{'ac_cv_func_$ac_func'+set}'`\" = set"; then

 else
   cat > conftest.$ac_ext <<EOF
-#line 6280 "configure"
+#line 6281 "configure"
 #include "confdefs.h"
 /* System header to define __stub macros and hopefully few prototypes,
     which can conflict with char $ac_func(); below.  */
@@ -6290,7 +6286,6 @@ else
 /* We use char because int might match the return type of a gcc2
     builtin and then its argument prototype would still apply.  */
 char $ac_func();
-char (*f)();
 
 int main() {
 
@@ -6300,7 +6295,7 @@ int main() {
 #if defined (__stub_$ac_func) || defined (__stub___$ac_func)
 choke me
 #else
-f = $ac_func;
+$ac_func();
 #endif
 
 ; return 0; }
@@ -6437,7 +6432,6 @@ else
 /* We use char because int might match the return type of a gcc2
     builtin and then its argument prototype would still apply.  */
 char $ac_func();
-char (*f)();
 
 int main() {
 
@@ -6447,12 +6441,12 @@ int main() {
 #if defined (__stub_$ac_func) || defined (__stub___$ac_func)
 choke me

-f = $ac_func;
+$ac_func();
 #endif
 
 ; return 0; }
 EOF
-if { (eval echo configure:6451: \"$ac_link\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_link) 2>&5; } && test -s conftest${ac_exeext}; then
+if { (eval echo configure:6450: \"$ac_link\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_link) 2>&5; } && test -s conftest${ac_exeext}; then
   rm -rf conftest*
   eval "ac_cv_func_$ac_func=yes"
 else

 done
 
 echo $ac_n "checking for working mmap""... $ac_c" 1>&6
-echo "configure:6476: checking for working mmap" >&5
+echo "configure:6475: checking for working mmap" >&5
 if eval "test \"`echo '$''{'ac_cv_func_mmap_fixed_mapped'+set}'`\" = set"; then
   echo $ac_n "(cached) $ac_c" 1>&6
 else

-#line 6484 "configure"
+#line 6483 "configure"
 #include "confdefs.h"
 
 /* Thanks to Mike Haertel and Jim Avera for this test.
@@ -6625,7 +6619,7 @@ main()
 }
